description: Used to start an incident from CloudWatch alarms, EventBridge events, or manually.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: A token ensuring that the operation is called only once with the specified details. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: impact
parameters.description: Defines the impact to the customers. Providing an impact overwrites the impact provided by a response plan. 1 - Critical 2 - High 3 - Medium 4 - Low 5 - No Impact.

parameters.name: relatedItems
parameters.description: Add related items to the incident for other responders to use. Related items are Amazon Web Services resources, external links, or files uploaded to an Amazon S3 bucket. (dict) --- Resources that responders use to triage and mitigate the incident. generatedId (string) --- A unique ID for a RelatedItem. Details about the related item. The type of related item. arn (string) --- The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the related item, if the related item is an Amazon resource. metricDefinition (string) --- The metric definition, if the related item is a metric in Amazon CloudWatch. pagerDutyIncidentDetail (dict) --- Details about an incident that is associated with a PagerDuty incident. autoResolve (boolean) --- Indicates whether to resolve the PagerDuty incident when you resolve the associated Incident Manager incident. The ID of the incident associated with the PagerDuty service for the response plan. secretId (string) --- The ID of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that stores your PagerDuty key, either a General Access REST API Key or User Token REST API Key, and other user credentials. url (string) --- The URL, if the related item is a non-Amazon Web Services resource. title (string) --- The title of the related item.

nested_params.name: generatedId
nested_params.description: A unique ID for a RelatedItem.

nested_params.name: arn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the related item, if the related item is an Amazon resource.

nested_params.name: metricDefinition
nested_params.description: The metric definition, if the related item is a metric in Amazon CloudWatch.

nested_params.name: pagerDutyIncidentDetail
nested_params.description: Details about an incident that is associated with a PagerDuty incident.

nested_params.name: autoResolve
nested_params.description: Indicates whether to resolve the PagerDuty incident when you resolve the associated Incident Manager incident.

nested_params.name: id
nested_params.description: The ID of the incident associated with the PagerDuty service for the response plan.

nested_params.name: secretId
nested_params.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret that stores your PagerDuty key, either a General Access REST API Key or User Token REST API Key, and other user credentials.

nested_params.name: url
nested_params.description: The URL, if the related item is a non-Amazon Web Services resource.

nested_params.name: title
nested_params.description: The title of the related item.

parameters.name: responsePlanArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan that pre-defines summary, chat channels, Amazon SNS topics, runbooks, title, and impact of the incident.

parameters.name: triggerDetails
parameters.description: Details of what created the incident record in Incident Manager. rawData (string) --- Raw data passed from either Amazon EventBridge, Amazon CloudWatch, or Incident Manager when an incident is created. Identifies the service that sourced the event. All events sourced from within Amazon Web Services begin with ' aws.' Customer-generated events can have any value here, as long as it doesn't begin with ' aws.' We recommend the use of Java package-name style reverse domain-name strings. The timestamp for when the incident was detected. triggerArn (string) --- The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source that detected the incident.

nested_params.name: rawData
nested_params.description: Raw data passed from either Amazon EventBridge, Amazon CloudWatch, or Incident Manager when an incident is created.

nested_params.name: source
nested_params.description: Identifies the service that sourced the event. All events sourced from within Amazon Web Services begin with ' aws.' Customer-generated events can have any value here, as long as it doesn't begin with ' aws.' We recommend the use of Java package-name style reverse domain-name strings.

nested_params.name: timestamp
nested_params.description: The timestamp for when the incident was detected.

nested_params.name: triggerArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source that detected the incident.

nested_items.name: incidentRecordArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the newly created incident record.
